page.title: 09Firs Farm,near Fletchertown.
page.content: On our farm we have these animals;dogs,cats,cows,calves and sheep.We have six tractors and a landrover.My dad gets up at 6.30 to milk the cows and feed the calves.He shouts to the cows in the summer when they are in the fields(in winter they are kept inside).My uncle Gerald comes to help dad milk the cows.My grandfather feeds the calves with powdered milk mixed with water. They finish the milking at about 8.10 and my uncle and grandfather go home for breakfast.On a sunny day in July my dad will be cutting hay to feed to the cows in winter.My grandfather feeds the sheep with crushed barley,which we grow on the farm.The cows are milked again in the evening. The milk tanker comes once a day to take our milk from the bulk tank to Aspatria Creamery,to be made into butter and cheese.
